EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.01
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM: 
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Cari Vaeth, Associate Superintendent of Human Resources
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Hold Public Hearing at Approximately 6:30 p.m. - Disclosure of Major Provisions of Proposed Tentative Agreement with San Jose Federation of Teachers, AFT Local 957, AFL-CIO, July 1, 2014 - June 30, 2016 (Per AB1200); Discussion and/or Action
	 
	 
In accordance with Assembly Bill 1200 requiring school districts to disclose, at a public meeting, the cost that would be incurred by the implementation of a collective bargaining agreement.  In meeting the requirement, a public hearing is being held to give our community an opportunity to comment on the cost of this tentative agreement.
	 
Attached is a copy of the proposed changes to the collective bargaining agreement with the San Jose Federation of Teachers, AFT Local 957, AFL-CIO.  The District and the San Jose Federation of Teachers, AFT Local 957, AFL-CIO reached a tentative agreement on December 17, 2014.  The tentative agreement was ratified by the San Jose Federation of Teachers, AFT Local 957 on January 7, 2015.
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees accept any comment on the proposed Tentative Agreement with the San Jose Federation of Teachers, AFT Local 957, AFL-CIO, July 1, 2014 – June 30, 2016 (Per AB1200).

EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.07
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM: 
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Cari Vaeth, Associate Superintendent of Human Resources
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Hold Public Hearing at Approximately 6:40 p.m. - Regarding the Proposed Adoption of the Initial Proposal for the Successor Contract: From East Side Union High School District to the East Side Teachers Association/CTA/NEA
	 
	 
The East Side Union High School District presents the following initial proposal to the East Side Teachers Association/CTA/NEA for the 2015-2016 school year.  Pursuant to Government Code §3547 the District’s initial proposal must be presented to the public in open session at a public meeting.
	 
The District continues to acknowledge and appreciate the contributions made to its mission and programs 
by its certificated employees, and continues to seek the utilization of equitable and collaborative methods 
of addressing the needs of the students, parents and employees of the East Side Union High School District.  Accordingly, the District initially proposes to continue the language of the present agreement for the 2015-2016 school year except as modified in a manner consistent with the matters and issues described below.
	 
The District proposes the following areas for negotiations: contract language amendments to Article 11 (Evaluation Procedure) and Article 15 (Class Size). The District seeks a one year agreement.
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
To be negotiated
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Various
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees sunshine and accept any comment on the District's initial proposal to the East Side Teachers Association/CTA/NEA.

EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  11.02
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM: 
Frank Biehl, Board Clerk
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Discussion and/or Action to Establish a Board Task Force Committee to Review Schools' Start Times
	 
	 
The American Academy of Pediatrics recognizes insufficient sleep in adolescents as an important public health issue that significantly affects the health and safety, as well as the academic success, of our nation’s middle and high school students.  A substantial body of research has now demonstrated that delaying school start times is an effective countermeasure to chronic sleep loss and has a wide range of potential benefits to students with regard to physical and mental health, safety, and academic achievement. 
	 
Trustee Biehl would like the Board to consider establishing a Task Force to review the research on moving school start times to a later start time (i.e. after 8:30 am) and the impact to bussing, extracurricular activities and the work and school day.
	 
	 
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board establish a Task Force to review the impact on moving school start times to later in the day.

TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM: 
J. Manuel Herrera, Board Trustee
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Discussion and/or Action regarding Board Vacancy: Process for Appointment and Provisional Appointment to the Governing Board
	 
	 
The 15-member Citizens Advisory Committee for the Board provisional appointment process concluded its work Tuesday evening, January 13, with a unanimous vote to recommend five finalists to the Board of Trustees. 
	 
The following applicants are the five finalists for the Board vacancy provisional appointment (listed alphabetically):
	 
Louis Barocio
Mariel Caballero
Pattie Cortese 
Wm. Derek Grasty
Merryl Kravitz
	 
We are grateful to the community members who applied for this Board vacancy provisional appointment, and we extend our congratulations to the five finalists.
	 
Interviews of the five finalists by the full Board will be held on Monday, January 26, 2015.  The meeting will begin at 6:00 PM and will be held in the ESUHSD Board Room.  The Board expects to make a final decision that evening and the newly appointed Board Member will be sworn into office that night.  This will be a provisional appointment to serve the two years that remain in the term of office held by former ESUHSD Board Member Magdalena Carrasco.

EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  13.04
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM: 
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Marcus Battle, Associate Superintendent of Business Services, and Karen Poon, Director of Finance
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Discussion and/or Action to Receive First Reading and Adopt Amendment to Board Policy 3105 Fund Balance (GASB 54)
	 
	 
Board Policy 3105, was adopted at the Board Meeting of October 16, 2014.  The following amendment to Board Policy 3105 is offered to change the percentage of reserve that the district will maintain as a reserve for economic uncertainties is being changed from 6% to 3%.  
	 
Board Bylaw 9310 allows the Board to review and approve this amendment as a "First Reading."  Specifically, the bylaw states that "The Board may waive the second reading or may require an additional reading, if necessary."  The District is requesting that the second reading be waived because the change is only related to an adjustment in the minimum fund balance reserve for economic uncertainties.  The recommended change in Board Policy 3105 is reflective of the requirements of GASB 54 which requires an accompanying resolution at the time when the original board policy is adopted by the Governing Board.
	 
The District is recommending a change in the adopted reserve for economic uncertainties because the District now believes that maintaining a minimum reserve of 3% is prudent in the current fiscal environment.  Returning the percentage to the State requirement level will allow the District more flexibility in budgeting.  The District may maintain a higher than required minimum "3%" in reserve if the Board and the Administration see it is prudent.       
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees receive first reading and adopt amendment to Board Policy 3105 Fund Balance (GASB 54).

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  13.05
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM: 
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Marcus Battle, Associate Superintendent of Business Services, and Karen Poon, Director of Finance
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Discussion and/or Action to Adopt Resolution #2014/2015-14 Committing Fund Balance in Accordance with GASB 54
	 
Board Resolution #2011/2012-14, which was approved on November 17, 2011, is being amended by the Board to authorize the District to fully utilize its fiscal resources within State guidelines to meet the increasing financial requirements and demands of the District.  The attached new Board Resolution #2014/2015-14 is being recommended in light of the recent passage of Proposition 2, which caps District reserves at 6% and requires the District to justify reserves higher than 6%.  The spirit of the new Proposition 2 law as proposed by Governor Brown and supported by the general public advocates for current dollars to be spent now to support instruction and to not store large reserves.
      
As such, the Board is hereby rescinding the requirement for the District to maintain an additional 3% statutory reserve for a total district minimum reserve of 6%.  The District minimum reserve requirements will be the minimum as established by law which is currently 3% for East Side Union High School District.       
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees to Adopt Resolution #2014/2015-14 Committing Fund Balance in Accordance with GASB 54.

EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  17.02
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
					 
FROM:
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
					 
					 
PREPARED BY:
Juan Cruz, Associate Superintendent of Educational Services
					 
SUBJECT:
Approve the 2015 Summer School Program
	 
In the strategic plan and Local Control Accountability Plan (LCAP), the District has outlined Key Performance Indicators (KPM) related to student's academic progress towards meeting A-G requirements.  Our summer program is an integral component to support our students in meeting our KPM's.  We will offer a program that focuses on creating a bridge between 8th grade to 9th grade.  In addition, we need to support our current students in recovering credits and accelerating students to access higher level courses.
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
$200,000.00 in additional funds
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
LCAP
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the 2015 Summer School Program.

SUBJECT:
Receive Update on After School Programs/Homework Centers
	 
	 
East Side Union High School District offers After School Programs/Homework Centers in most of our eleven comprehensive high schools and two of our alternative high schools.  Four of our schools (Oak Grove, Mt. Pleasant, Independence and Silver Creek) have received After School Assets Grants and offer a wide array of academic and enrichment activities.
	 
	 
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees receive the After School Programs/Home Centers Report.

Item:  21.03
		 
		 
TO:
Board of Trustees
						 
FROM:
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
						 
						 
PREPARED BY:
Juan Cruz, Associate Superintendent of Educational Services
						 
SUBJECT:
Receive English Language Development (ELD) Report 
		 
East Side Union High School District is reporting the on English Language Development (ELD) Program for students whose primary language is something other than English.  Not all schools have enough students to offer the program.   Students have to enroll at neighboring schools that have the program.  Our student population is shifting, a committee was formed to develop a recommendation on a Comprehensive ELD Program for 2015-2016 school year.  Attached is the breakdown of the number of students in our ELD Program by school.
		 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees receive the English Language Development (ELD) report.
